column4: hi all. i'm unable to get the grub boot menu to show up, so i can't pick my other OS. what should i do?
edit /etc/default/grub
comment out the line that says GRUB_HIDDEN_TIMEOUT by adding a # to the begging of the line, i believe
i have. i changed the quiet behavior to false
hmm...i may not have done that
then finally, run sudo update-grub
ok i'll try that
do it :)
thanks for the tip
no problem. i think that's how i did it
i think you may want to set HIDDEN_TIMEOUT_QUIET to true, if it doesn't work. at least that's what's in my config and i see the grub menu
not sure if it matters, but i do get an error message during grub.cfg generation, complaining about "wrong # of devices" in a raid set on /dev/sda
although i don't have raid on this machine
that's strange. not sure why it would say that then. no softraid either?
nope
maybe you should check it out on google before rebooting your machine, if you dont have a live cd ready
i do have a live cd, and i've gotten that error before
it could be hard to boot it if grub gets messed up you know
but fair warning
see you folks in a bit...
alright, well i doubt it's related to you not seeing the grub menu. anyways should work now
i dont see how video drivers would affect that, dont think theyre even loaded'at the time of grub
you, sir, are a gentleman and a scholar. i can now choose what i want to boot, win7 boots great, the sky is blue and the world is a happy place again.
